item.title: Report X-2023110789
item.description:
Report X-2023110789

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded onto trailer 835069. Package located in the belly, laying upside down. This caused the bottle to leak, damaging the outer packaging. Unload manager contacted QA for proper retrieval and care on 11/6/2023 @ 6am, DescribePack: 4 bottles placed inside of package. Childproof caps with tape over them to prevent spillage. Package placed upside down in belly of trailer when loading it at NASH. Causing caps to leak and spill a 7in hole in side of packaging. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated and removed from area.

item.title: Report X-2023110871
item.description:
Report X-2023110871

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap became loose causing an internal leakage, wetting the packaging . We were called to take the hazmat. We tightened the cap and secured the slightly soiled package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap was loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote and the caps were tightened

item.title: Report X-2023110655
item.description:
Report X-2023110655

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on pallet with other packages, boxes got tipped and fell on hazmat crushing it. DescribePack: One jug of lime-a-way handle cracked and leaked. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Sort was stopped and QA came over with proper PPE equipment. They followed the hazmat SDS to properly deal with package. They inspected package and were able to contain spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023110118
item.description:
Report E-2023110118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 teaspoons of (UN1917) Ethyl Acrylate (3/II) -was released from (1) 55-gallon DM due to improper packaging. Contractors arrived to find that a drum of DOW ethyl Acrylate with a pinhole puncture that released an extremely small amount of product onto the side of the damaged drum and potentially onto the trailer floor. The released material has fully evaporated but as a precaution, all nearby surfaces were treated with a simple green solution and was wiped down with pads. The damaged drum was overpacked and all impacted surfaces were cleaned and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110177
item.description:
Report X-2023110177

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A HAZMAT SPILL ON IR2, RESPONDER USED PPE AND DROVE THE SPILL TUG OVER TO THE LEAK. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER SAW THE CORROSIVE HAZMAT LABEL, RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND FOLLOWED THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
